p: In establishing a new LAMP diagnostic assay, it is important to optimize the protocol and include the proper controls to limit the risk of false positives or non-target amplification [ 40]. Variables to consider in LAMP optimization include Mg 2+ concentrations, dNTP mix concentrations, primers, time reaction, and temperature reaction, which all have a key role in producing reliable results [ 40, 42, 44, 64]. Lower LAMP temperatures and excessive free Mg 2+ ions are associated with non-target amplification [ 27], and, indeed, previous studies have reported false-positive results in RT-LAMP assays [ 40, 41, 44, 64].
